title.label: This game desperately needs fast forward button

content.label:
The game is excellent but drags extensively at times. Need ability to fast forward like other popular tower defense

I also prefer one tap to upgrade tower vs two taps. When you‚Äôre in the middle of battle those extra1/2 seconds of extra taps make huge differences

During a game, If I receive phone call the app freezes. I could be deep in waves and have to start over because this bug. It‚Äôs happen multiple times, if it wasn‚Äôt for the annoyance I could‚Äôve rated 4+

title.label: Upgrade towers cost more than game?

content.label: Love the series but not the in app purchases. The game is really enjoyable and there are a lot of fun quotes. However, the cost to buy the extra towers and extra heroes is absolutely ridiculous. Each one cost more than the actual game and it makes no sense to me. I would consider it if they were $.99 or two dollars, but seven dollars and up for some of them? It‚Äôs ONE tower. Or ONE hero.

title.label: Near-Perfect, but Spoiled by In-App Purchases

content.label: The only flaw of this game is that it gives you three heroes to choose from. The other 10ish cost between $2.99 and $7.99. A pitiful thing to do to your gamers!

Final verdict: if you want to buy this game, buy the original kingdom rush or frontiers. It‚Äôs much better. Anyway, Kingdom rush fanboy through and through, so I‚Äôm going to be harsh. Decent game, but compared to the first two and even the third, lacking. I‚Äôm going to be real here. Ive played kingdom rush since I was probably 8 or 9. Easily one of the best games I‚Äôve ever played. Tower defense usually, IMO, aren‚Äôt fun or complex enough to peak my interest. KR is the exception. The way it‚Äôs designed makes it sooo much fun. I love it. KR 1 and KR frontiers (the latter being my personal favorite) are amazing. Origins is less aesthetically pleasing (the mushroom forest is purple.... yeah), and the towers are less interesting, but it still has whatever makes KR amazing in its DNA. Vengeance doesn‚Äôt do it for me. It falls back with other tower defense games. No story that makes you sentimental when you finish it. The soundtrack is lacking and kinda of annoying at times. The heroes are bland and unremarkable. They add a humorous element in, but it makes the story seem trivial and unserious, whereas in previous games humor didn‚Äôt take away from the story. Enemies are easy to defeat. The skill tree is inferior compared to previous games. There‚Äôs no reason to do heroic or iron challenges. Towers are unbalanced. Ironically, them adding in more towers leads to less tower diversity, because two or three towers always get used no matter what because of the balance problem. And finally The biggest problem I have, the towers. In old KR games, there were four basic towers, and when you got to level 4, they turned into one of two specialized towers of your choice that worked in different ways. In this game, the towers do not change in this way, they just get stronger, minus special abilities at max level. Now there are some good things. The environments were stellar. They were a little too polished for me, but they did a good job. Not as good as KR frontiers, where there was jungle, pirate coves, underground caves, and desert, but still good. The premise of being vez‚Äônan is interesting. I wish they took him a little more seriously, but it still works. The bosses are pretty good, they are hard and interesting. But if you haven‚Äôt played the first three, there‚Äôs no point in playing this one. Play the first three first, in order, or if you just want one, I‚Äôd recommend frontiers.

Iron hide Kingdom Rush Vengeance!, Just Freakin Awesome!!! All there games are astonishing and just the best to play!

title.label: Not as good as the first

content.label: The first three kingdom rush games where amazing! This game is very fun but i would like it a lot better if it was more like the first three. Ironhide please make another kingdom rush like the first three!!

I‚Äôve had all the Kingdom Rush games and never had any bug issues but this game seems to be riddled with them. If Screen Time blocks the app when you give it more time it stays locked up and you have to reboot it. I‚Äôve had it lock up on me many times on my new iPad & iPhone X.

The tower defense is great, if not a little heavy on the micromanaging of your heroes and units. Definitely challenging throughout the map. I really don‚Äôt like all of the ‚Äúbuy now‚Äù all over the place in a game I already paid to get.
I think they made some questionable design and monetization decisions, but overall it‚Äôs still the very high quality game I‚Äôve come to expect from IronHide
The pay wall is too high
Paid $5 for 60% of the game the rest will cost you $20-30 more to unlock. Don‚Äôt be fooled

The art is wonderful and I‚Äôve enjoyed each of the levels, yet I‚Äôm left with an overall feeling of disappointed due to seven of the towers being locked behind an additional paywall.  Experimenting with different tower mechanics is most of the fun in tower defense, not being able to explore all of them for the initial price of entry feels unfriendly to players - it discourages me from attempting any of the unlocked challenges.

title.label: Good game, but large curve if you have the money to spend

content.label: I loved Kingdom Rush - I used to play the flash games before they were apps and always looked out for a new game from Ironhide. This one is disappointing because even though the team says the game is designed to be beaten without any add-ons, it‚Äôs very difficult EVEN ON CASUAL MODE to beat the extra levels at the end. There‚Äôs lots of extra content like heroes and towers that you need to pay (quite a lot!) for and having already paid $5 for the game they should be lower priced or AT LEAST a package for all towers or all heroes for like, $10. And just having an option to pay $50 for a bunch of gems is ridiculous to me. The team has turned kinda greedy. Please make some changes to my favorite tower defense game creators!!

This is an amazing game from an amazing game series, but there‚Äôs 1 problem. As much as I love this game it REALLY needs a endless mode. All the other games had endless modes, so why does this one not have one? Just PLEASE add an endless mode by the end of the year.
I swear there isn‚Äôt a more consistent company this game delivered!!! Can‚Äôt wait for moreüôèüôèüôè

title.label: when would it sale on the steam.

content.label: I am an absolute fan of iron hide. I played your game at least 10 years. I played the whole series three time straight. It is a great part of my childhood and a place for me now to relive the happiness of the childhood. I really wish to experience vengeance on bigger screen with better quality on my computer as well. Also, I wish we can have a longer level where we can fully maxed out every tower on the maps, or the level wouldn‚Äôt ended even we defeated the final boss. Just an opinion, thank you iron-hide for producing such a great series.

title.label: TONS of levels. Lacks an Endless mode

content.label: Title says it all. This game had more levels then any of the other installments in the series besides the first game. Only problem is that the game lacks an Endless mode like all of the other installments do. This is a real shame, because the Endless mode in the other games is the replay-ability. It‚Äôs the reason you keep playing after you‚Äôve beaten every level. If this game gets an Endless mode added, it would be an EASY 5 stars. Its my personal favorite installment in the series.
One of the best tower games I‚Äôve played ! Money well spent, please keep the fun going
Whenever a new game by ironhide comes out I instantly play it  I always can‚Äôt wait for the next game whether it be iron marines or the next kingdom rush I can‚Äôt wait!

This game was an absolute blast from start to finish. I purchased the premium towers at the beginning with the discount because these are truly worthy developers of some excellent games. But I can see it being less replayable with only the free towers. I think it needs an endless mode or three and possibly daily challenges with special rewards. I think it would be neat if you could swap out abilities like the goonies or green fire rain for different abilities like how you can with the heroes. And more free heroes.

Not gonna lie, I‚Äôm ok with the in app purchases, and I‚Äôm probably gonna buy a tower or a hero pretty soon. The game is awesome, I love the new things that were added, and I like that most levels have something making it unique. I just wish there was an endless mode.

UPDATE- I bought like three heroes, Eiskalt was one, and bought a tower. I must say. Worth it. For those of you complaining about the price, clearly don‚Äôt understand how overpowered the dragons are. LOVE THIS GAME.
Another solid game from Ironhide.  Wish you could earn all heroes/towers somehow instead of just buying them.  Still a great game for 5 bucks

I never thought I would need to write this, but your IAPs should never cost more than a premium game...

For $5 you get a DEMO of a game. 3 free unlockable heros, while 10 or so sit behind an actual pay wall. 5 free unlockable towers, while 7 sit behind a paywall... 

If you charge $5 for a game, you should have access to ALL THE CONTENT. I wouldn‚Äôt even care if you had to buy with with gems because you can at least earn then by playing the game...

Really disappointed in the developer and publisher. Shameful.
